intro: Pseudolmedia krukovii, commonly known as the Krukovii's pseudolmedia, is a rare and lesser-known plant species. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
